baseline_groups.claim_summary: Political alignment (same party controls municipal and regional government) causes higher intergovernmental transfers per capita from regional to local governments, identified via fuzzy RD at the 50% vote share threshold.
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline uses IV-2SLS with local quadratic polynomial (dist1, dist2), region FE (codccaa), clustered at municipality (codiine). Coefficient ~98 euros per capita.

global_notes: The specification search covers 95 specs. One main baseline claim: alignment causes higher transfers. Competition-moderation is secondary (heterogeneity). First-stage/reduced-form and covariate balance tests are diagnostic. Placebo cutoff tests are noncore_placebo. Several specs duplicate results under different labels. Some OLS specs use a different estimator but test the same directional claim. Region-specific heterogeneity specs run OLS on individual region subsamples.
